required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: First-in-Human Trial of Single Ascending Dose, Multiple Ascending Dose and Malaria Challenge Model in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, First-in-Human, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial of Single and Multiple Ascending Doses of M5717 to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic Profile of Oral Doses, and to Assess the Antimalarial Activity of M5717 Against Plasmodium Falciparum in Healthy Male and Female Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to investigate the safety and tolerability of M5717 and to characterize the Pharmacokinetics /Pharmacodynamic relationship between M5717 PK and parasite clearance in healthy subjects following infection with Plasmodium falciparum.

primary_outcome.measure: Part A and Part B: Occurrence and Severity of Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to end of trial visit (Week 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Parasite Clearance Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimal Inhibitory Concentration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Lag Phase Assessed by Steady Exponential Decline in Parasite Count
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)
secondary_outcome.description: Lag phase is defined as the time period (measured in hours) between administration of the test drug to a parasite infected subject until first sign of parasiticidal effect in terms of steady exponential decline in the parasite count.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Recrudescence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Malarial Clinical Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C: Occurrence of Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Serious AEs (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to end of trial visit (Week 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C: Occurrence of TEAEs and SAEs by Severity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to end of trial visit (Week 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part C: Occurrence of Clinically Significant Changes and Abnormalities From Baseline in Vital Signs, Laboratory Parameters and 12-lead Electrocardiogram (ECG) Findings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to end of trial visit (Week 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part A: Elimination Rate Constant (λz)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to end of trial visit (Week 7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimal Parasiticidal Concentration (MPC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)

secondary_outcome.measure: Parasite Clearance Half-life (PCt½)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Week 4 (Day 22)
secondary_outcome.description: The parasite clearance half-life, defined as the time needed for parasitemia to be reduced by half during the log-linear phase of parasite clearance.

intervention.description: Subjects will receive single ascending oral dose of M5717 after at least 8 hours of fasting together with water on Day 1, followed by a 4-hour post-dose fast
Subjects will receive multiple ascending oral doses of M5717 after an overnight fast of at least 8 hours once daily for 3 days, followed by a 4-hour post-dose fast
Subjects will receive placebo matched to M5717

Subjects will receive single ascending oral dose of M5717 from Part A or as applicable multiple ascending oral doses of M5717 from Part B after at least 8 hours of fasting together with water on Day 1, followed by a 4-hour post-dose fast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult men and women of non-childbearing potential, with total body weight greater than or equal to 50.0 kilogram and body mass index (BMI) between 19.0 kilogram per meter square(kg/m^2) and 29.9 kg/m^2.
- Healthy as assessed by the Investigator with no clinically significant abnormality identified on physical examination or laboratory evaluation and no active clinically significant disorder, condition, infection or disease that would pose a risk to subject safety or interfere with the trial evaluation, procedures, or completion.
- Other protocol defined inclusion criteria could apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with history or presence of clinically relevant respiratory, gastrointestinal, renal, hepatic, hematological, lymphatic, neurological, cardiovascular, psychiatric, musculoskeletal, genitourinary, immunological dermatological, connective tissue diseases or disorders.
- Subjects with history of relevant drug hypersensitivity, ascertained or presumptive allergy/hypersensitivity to the active drug substance and/or formulation ingredients; history of serious allergic reactions leading to hospitalization or any other allergic reaction in general, which the Investigator considers may affect the safety of the subject and/or outcome of the trial.
- Subjects who have any history of malaria.
- Subjects who have participated in a previous malaria vaccine trial.
- Subjects who have participated in a previous human malaria challenge trial.
